title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for the correct choice.

1 point is earned for the correct explanation.

Ethyne, which contains a triple bond, has the shortest C–to–C bond. The other molecules have single C–to–C bonds, and triple bonds are shorter than single bonds.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for the correct choice with justification.

The statement is false. All of the bonds described are intramolecular; these bonds are not broken during vaporization. When ethanol boils, the added energy overcomes intermolecular, not intramolecular, forces.
descriptions:
The student response earns none of the following points:

1 point is earned for the correct choice with justification.

The statement is false. All of the bonds described are intramolecular; these bonds are not broken during vaporization. When ethanol boils, the added energy overcomes intermolecular, not intramolecular, forces.

The student response earns one of the following points:

1 point is earned for the correct choice with justification.

title: Part E
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for a correct choice with justification.

Either ethane or ethyne may be identified as nonpolar.

The ethane/ethyne molecule is nonpolar because all of the bond dipoles in the molecule cancel.

OR

The ethane/ethyne molecule is nonpolar because the molecule is symmetric.

Note: Explanation must refer to the shape of the molecule. Statements such as: “all hydrocarbons are nonpolar", “the carbons are surrounded by hydrogens” or “there are no lone pairs” do not earn this point.

title: Part F
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for the correct explanation.

Ethanol is able to form strong hydrogen bonds with water whereas ethanethiol does not have similar capability. The formation of hydrogen bonds increases the attraction between molecules of ethanol and molecules of water, making them more soluble in each other.

Note: The answer must clearly focus on the solute-solvent interaction. Just the mention of hydrogen bonding does not earn the point.
